intro: Oligosporus commutatus, commonly known as the commutated oligosporus, is a lesser-known species within the fungal kingdom. It belongs to the family Sordariaceae and is characterized by its unique spore morphology. The plant exhibits a dimorphic life cycle, switching between a mycelial and a sporulating form under different environmental conditions. Its spores are typically small, ellipsoidal, and ornamented with fine, reticulate patterns. This species is often found in moist, decaying organic matter, contributing to nutrient cycling in forest ecosystems.
